meanings.definition: An abnormal or disordered state of the body or of a bodily part.
meanings.sent1: The doctor diagnosed the dyscrasia in the patient's liver.
meanings.sent2: The dyscrasia in her blood cells caused her fatigue.
meanings.sent3: The dyscrasia in the stomach made it act like a grumbling monster.
meanings.sent4: The dyscrasia of the engine made the car sputter and stall.
meanings.sent5: The dyscrasia of the garden soil turned it into a barren wasteland.

meanings.definition: A morbid condition or state, especially when characterized by a disturbance of normal functioning.
meanings.sent1: The dyscrasia of the virus spread rapidly through the population.
meanings.sent2: Her persistent cough was a sign of dyscrasia in her lungs.
meanings.sent3: The dyscrasia of the broken clock made it chime randomly.
meanings.sent4: The dyscrasia of the team's communication led to chaos.
meanings.sent5: The dyscrasia of the storm turned the peaceful night into a frenzy of wind and rain.
